description:
This is roughly the "upper" half of Barnard's Loop, Sh2-276, in Ha. The subs as they came down were in horizontal mode, with LDN 1622, the Boogie Man Nebula [top just left of center], on his head. When we typically look at the area around Orion the Loop is in a vertical orientation, to the "left "of the main constellation stars. I rotated the final image to this more typical and familiar vertical position. The poor Boogie Man is now sideways, but it is space, after all...no real up or down.
I am about to hopefully be able to add a filter wheel to this setup and not use a filter drawer, so plan to gather OIII and perhaps SII data for further presentations.

...Stephen

capture:
Sigma 135 f/1.8 Art @ f/3.5
ASI 1600MM cooled
Baader Ha3.5nm filter
Paramount MX+

guiding:
William Optics 50 x 200 guide scope
ASI 290 M Mini guider

TheSkyX, SGP, PHD2
PixInsight, Topaz deNoise AI, Preview
[30] 600s guided subs
5 hours integration
title: Barnard's Loop, Ha
